The paragraph is about the results of a study on the effect of different medications (atropine, placebo, atenolol, and propranolol) on CD25 levels. The paragraph mentions the CD25 levels after each medication, but it does not mention any diseases or conditions associated with CD25. Therefore, there are no disease entities in the paragraph.

Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: After atropine the CD25 was unchanged after placebo ( 2 . 3 + / - 0 . 3 micrograms ) and atenolol ( 7 . 7 + / - 1 . 3 micrograms ) ; it was reduced after propranolol ( 24 . 8 + / - 5 . 0 micrograms ) , but remained different from atenolol .

Let's think step by step.

| --- |
| atropine |
| CD25 |
| placebo |
| atenolol |
| propranolol |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| atropine |

The "CD25" is not a chemical entity, but a protein (CD25 is the interleukin-2 receptor alpha chain). The "it was reduced" and "remained different" are not chemical entities and can be removed from the table. The "after" and "from" are also not chemical entities and can be removed. The "2.3 + / - 0.3 micrograms", "7.7 + / - 1.3 micrograms", and "24.8 + / - 5.0 micrograms" are measurements of the concentration of the chemicals, but the units ("micrograms") are implicit in the context and do not need to be included in the table.
